headline.main: EISENHOWER HONORS CLARK FOR MISSION; Pre-Invasion Submarine Exploit Brings General D.S.M.

lead_paragraph: ALLLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, Dec. 1 (AP) -- Lieut. Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower, Allied Commander in Chief in North Africa, personally decorated Lieut. Gen. Mark W. Clark with the Distinguished Service Medal today for his "outstanding characteristics of leadership, sound judgment and soldierly qualities" in carrying out a hazardous secret mission to Africa before the Allied invasion.
abstract: Attends Lt Gen Clark's DSM presentation ceremony
